title: iPad Touch HW - Touch EE Engineer
summary: The Sensor Technology team develops cutting-edge sensor solutions and technologies that are central to Apple’s products. The key goal of the team is to enable the world’s best user-experience through state-of-the-art sensor solutions, such as the high-precision, low-latency multi-touch and stylus sensors in our products. New challenges arise everyday that require the sharp problem-solving skills of talented and smart individuals. The team features a collaborative and hands-on environment that fosters engineering excellence, creativity, and innovation.
description: Sensor technology scoping and proof-of-concept investigations Support Product definition, Market Surveys, Competitive Analysis Collaborate across the board, with different technology teams to evaluate the System design options & trade-offs Cross-functional leadership, guidance and mentoring to engineers Sensor & Module design and modeling End-to-end application (sensor, signal processing, ASIC, algorithm configurations) definition and design Oversee complete module design and execution, tracking various architectural and execution risks, schedule and inter-team collaboration Review and/or define algorithms for various signal and noise conditioning requirements -Design, prototyping and integration of Sensor, (rigid / flexible) PCBs and ASIC application -Optimize design across multi-disciplinary boundaries (e.g., Mechanical, Materials, Process, FW/SW/ Algorithms, Cal /Test, Reliability, Operations) Failure mode analysis, root cause diagnosis, and system-level problem solving -Statistical data analysis and data mining Design analysis, characterization, and validation Business travel to support product development
key_qualifications: • Strong logical thought process and analytical skill set. Ability to break-down complex problems fundamental blocks that can be analyzed via understanding of electro-magnetic interactions • Electrical engineering background in analog and mixed-signal design, especially board-level circuits • Hands-on experience in system-level design • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and solid teamwork and leadership skills • Proficiency in FEA (Comsol, ANSYS, Maxwell) MATLAB, SPICE, or similar simulation and modeling tools
education_experience: BS and a minimum of 3 years relevant industry experience
